Use the position of the sun to determine time: By observing the position of the sun in the sky, you can estimate the time of day. This method is based on the fact that the sun rises in the east and sets in the west, and its position changes throughout the day.

Use natural phenomena to measure time: There are many natural phenomena that can be used to measure time, such as the ebb and flow of the tides, the changing colors of the sky during sunrise and sunset, and the movement of the stars.
Use the changing seasons to measure time: The changing seasons can be used to measure time by observing the length of days and nights as the year progresses.
Use the changing light to measure time: The changing light throughout the day can be used to measure time by observing the position of the sun and the length of the shadows.
Use the changing weather to measure time: The changing weather patterns can be used to measure time by observing the patterns of rainfall, snowfall, and temperature changes.
